snippet: The assault began when militants fired two rockets that punched a hole in the airport perimeter wall, wounding at least 40.
abstract: Taliban militants attack airport in Peshawar, main city in northwestern Pakistan, leaving seven dead, including two civilians, and at least 40 people wounded, most of them civilians.

byline.contributor: Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The assault began when militants fired two rockets that punched a hole in the airport perimeter wall, wounding at least 40.

headline.main: Militants’ Attack on Airport Leaves 7 Dead in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Militants’ Attack on Airport Leaves 7 Dead in Pakistan
